text: I can certainly relate to that as in the past, through sheer frustration and lack of time, I've thrown strategies together in a very "shit or bust" fashion and ended up with a profit but wasn't sure why. Nowadays, most of my strategies evolve around some simple triggers that attempt to indicate when a market/runner has reached "true" price and the bots then use offsets based around these. I'm not bothered whether the bets get matched or not as the bets are placed at what the bot believes are good value prices.

elements.text: I can certainly relate to that as in the past, through sheer frustration and lack of time, I've thrown strategies together in a very "shit or bust" fashion and ended up with a profit but wasn't sure why. Nowadays, most of my strategies evolve around some simple triggers that attempt to indicate when a market/runner has reached "true" price and the bots then use offsets based around these. I'm not bothered whether the bets get matched or not as the bets are placed at what the bot believes are good value prices.

text: Actually, now that I've written that down, I'm questioning my own ability. I've not watched a betfair market for at least 5 years, so as such I'm developing strategies blindly, using nothing but educated guesses. I do test them on historical data before going live, but in reality everything is based on assumptions that I've accumulated over the last 30 years, mixed with a handful of new ideas I've read on various forums and betting blogs.
